alert.note: Alert for Malheur County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 3:11PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Canyon, northwestern Owyhee and east central Malheur Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 410 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Owyhee Dam to near Knottingham Butte. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Board Corral Mountain, Pelican Point and northern Owyhee Reservoir around 420 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Malheur County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley
